006
007package renderer.models_F;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011
012/**
013   Create a wireframe model of a regular icosahedron
014   with its center at the origin, having edge length
015   <pre>{@code
016     4/(1+sqrt(5)) = 1.2361,
017   }</pre>
018   and with its vertices on a sphere of radius
019   <pre>{@code
020     4/(1+sqrt(5)) * sin(2Pi/5) = 1.1756.
021   }</pre>
022<p>
023   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regular_icosahedron" target="_top">
024                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regular_icosahedron</a>
025
026   @see Tetrahedron
027   @see Cube
028   @see Octahedron
029   @see Dodecahedron
030*/
031public class Icosahedron extends Model
032{
033   /**
034      Create a regular icosahedron with its center at
035      the origin, having edge length
036      <pre>{@code
037        4/(1+sqrt(5)) = 1.2361,
038      }</pre>
039      and with its vertices on a sphere of radius
040      <pre>{@code
041        4/(1+sqrt(5)) * sin(2Pi/5) = 1.1756.
042      }</pre>
043   */
044   public Icosahedron()
045   {
046      super("Icosahedron");
047
048      // Create the icosahedron's geometry.
049      // It has 12 vertices, 30 edges, and 20 facess.
050      final double t = (1 + Math.sqrt(5))/2;  // golden ratio
051      final double r = 1/t;
052      //https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regular_icosahedron#Cartesian_coordinates
053      // All cyclic permutations of (0, ±r, ±1).
054      addVertex(new Vertex(-r,  1,  0),
055                new Vertex( r,  1,  0),
056                new Vertex(-r, -1,  0),
057                new Vertex( r, -1,  0),
058                new Vertex( 0, -r,  1),
059                new Vertex( 0,  r,  1),
060                new Vertex( 0, -r, -1),
061                new Vertex( 0,  r, -1),
062                new Vertex( 1,  0, -r),
063                new Vertex( 1,  0,  r),
064                new Vertex(-1,  0, -r),
065                new Vertex(-1,  0,  r));
066/*
067      // These vertices create a icosahedron with edge length 2,
068      // and vertices on a sphere of radius
069      //    sqrt(10+2sqrt(5))/2 = 2sin(2Pi/5) = 1.90211.
070      //https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regular_icosahedron#Cartesian_coordinates
071      // and also
072      //https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/blob/master/src/geometries/IcosahedronGeometry.js
073      // All cyclic permutations of (0, ±1, ±t).
074      addVertex(new Vertex(-1,  t,  0),
075                new Vertex( 1,  t,  0),
076                new Vertex(-1, -t,  0),
077                new Vertex( 1, -t,  0),
078                new Vertex( 0, -1,  t),
079                new Vertex( 0,  1,  t),
080                new Vertex( 0, -1, -t),
081                new Vertex( 0,  1, -t),
082                new Vertex( t,  0, -1),
083                new Vertex( t,  0,  1),
084                new Vertex(-t,  0, -1),
085                new Vertex(-t,  0,  1));
086*/
087      // To figure out the edges, look at the orthogonal projection in the z-direction.
088      // https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regular_icosahedron#Orthogonal_projections
089
090      // The edge from v00 to v01 is the top horizontal edge.
091      // The edge from v02 to v03 is the bottom horizontal edge.
092      // The edge from v04 to v05 is the front vertical edge.
093      // The edge from v06 to v07 is the back vertical edge.
094      // The edge from v08 to v09 is the right horizontal edge.
095      // The edge from v10 to v11 is the left horizontal edge.
096
097      // https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/blob/master/src/geometries/IcosahedronGeometry.js
098      // Working, more or less, from the top down.
099      addPrimitive(new Face(0,  5,  1),
100                   new Face(0,  1,  7),
101                   new Face(0, 11,  5),
102                   new Face(0,  7, 10),
103                   new Face(0, 10, 11),
104                   new Face(1,  5,  9),
105                   new Face(1,  8,  7),
106                   new Face(1,  9,  8),
107                   new Face(4,  5, 11),
108                   new Face(6, 10,  7),
109                   new Face(4,  9,  5),
110                   new Face(6,  7,  8),
111                   new Face(2, 11, 10),
112                   new Face(3,  8,  9),
113                   new Face(2,  4, 11),
114                   new Face(2, 10,  6),
115                   new Face(3,  9,  4),
116                   new Face(3,  6,  8),
117                   new Face(2,  3,  4),
118                   new Face(2,  6,  3));
119
120      // Highlight each vertex of the icosahedron.
121      final Points pts1 = new Points(0, 3),
122                   pts2 = new Points(1, 7, 10, 11, 5),
123                   pts3 = new Points(8, 6,  2,  4, 9);
124      pts1.radius = 10;
125      pts2.radius = 5;
126      pts3.radius = 5;
127      addPrimitive(pts1, pts2, pts3);
128   }
129}//Icosahedron
